conclusion: Analyze forces and equilibrium conditions before and after changing mass of object C.
Object A has mass 2m, Object B has mass 3m, Object C has mass m, spring constant is k.
In initial state, system is in equilibrium with forces balanced.
Tension in rope connected to A is T1 = 2mg.
Initial compression of spring is kx1 = 3mg.
Tension in rope connected to C is T2 = mg.
In equilibrium, T1 = T2 implies 2mg = mg, hence T1 = T2 = mg.
Mass of object C is changed to 5m.
In new equilibrium state, analyze forces again.
New tension in rope connected to A is T1' = 2mg.
New compression of spring is kx2 = 3mg.
New tension in rope connected to C is T2' = 5mg.
In equilibrium, T1' = T2' implies 2mg = 5mg, hence T1' = T2' = 5mg.
Initial compression x1 is x1 = 3mg/k.
New compression x2 is x2 = 3mg/k.
Spring compression remains same, height A rises determined by position change of C.
Initial height difference between A and C is x1.
New height difference between A and C is x2.
Since x1 = x2, height A rises is Î”h = x2 - x1 = 0.
Final answer: height A rises during process is 0.
